name: Seahorse and Swordfish Project
description:
One of my School projects where we make a game in a week or less. The theme was 2 animals picked from a list of animals. The ones I chose were a Seahorse and a Sword fish.

To use the menu, press [ENTER] to select choose in the menu. When playing the game, pressing [ENTER] will return you to the menu.

Use the ASWD keys to move the seahorse.
- They cannot move past purple rocks
- They can hide in pink coral
-They need to hunt brine shrimp to keep being fed, but be smart about it as brine shrimp will run away if you're too close and not hidden!

Use the right mouse button to click where to move the Swordfish
- The Swordfish can move past purple rocks
- The Swordfish can damage enemy fish upon touch
- After defeating an enemy, the swordfish will go into a Combo Mode, which will allow the Swordfish to move quickly and eat up fish quickly to clear the map of enemies.

Watch out for the Yellow Tails and Atlantic Cod Fish!
- They will go after the Seahorse directly, passing through the purple rocks
-They will spawn from time to time, so have the Swordfish clear them out to help the Seahorse be on their way!

You win the game if you can get the Seahorse to the other seahorse friends!

You'll lose if:
- The Seahorse runs out of health
- The Seahorse starves

Made with Gamemaker Studio 2, Windows 10
Made under a week, Project #5 of 9

I don't know if the game is playable on other systems, I have only tested and played it on Windows.
